title: Police raid Australian official's home after media raids
text:
CANBERRA, Australia (AP) - Police have executed a search warrant on the home of an Australian intelligence officer in a raid that one media executive has described as an attempt to intimidate people who talk to journalists.

The raid on Wednesday on a Canberra house owned by Australian Signals Directorate official Cameron Gill came three months after police caused widespread outrage by raiding the Canberra home of News Corp. journalist Annika Smethurst and Australian Broadcasting Corp.’s Sydney headquarters.

News Corp. Australia executive Campbell Reid linked Wednesday’s raid to the June 4 raid on Smethurst’s home over a story she wrote last year about the Australian Signals Directorate.

Reid described Wednesday’s raid as a continuation of a process of intimidation that began in June.

description: Police have executed a search warrant on the home of an Australian intelligence officer in a raid that one media executive has described as an attempt to intimidate people who talk to journalists.
